intro: Securidaca ecristata, commonly known as the African velvet bean, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and useful in traditional practices.
